column1: # Source: Table ET5. Industrial Sector Energy Price and Expenditure Estimates by Source 1970-2018 United States; https://www.eia.gov/state/seds/data.php?incfile=/state/seds/sep_prices/ind/pr_ind_US.html&sid=US

# Comments:  Industrial prices are used because these tend to be the lowest end-use prices.  Additional costs are added to GCAM's delivered gas / coal sectors to reflect the reality that building and transport gas prices are often higher.

# Using a cross-sector average price (e.g. https://www.eia.gov/state/seds/data.php?incfile=/state/seds/sep_prices/total/pr_tot_US.html&sid=US) would tend to over-estimate costs because this average includes higher cost building and transportation supplies; GCAM represents these costs explicitly and separately.
